pullRequest.title: Support for implicit casting of dynamic filters

nodes.bodyText: no need to revalidate these. These are validated as part of other tests (e.g testJoinDynamicFilteringSingleValue)
add a comment what this asserts (e.g no DF)
new InterpretedFunctionInvoker(requireNotNull(metadata, "metadata is null"))
this is the case where // Coerced domain is narrower than the original domain. Only the floor can return greater value
this is not neccecerly that case. Lower value can be within domain.
that should be exact
In case when high is outside of valid coerced domain, we should return Optional.empty(). Do we have a test for this?
similar comment as above, coercedValueIsGreaterThanOriginal means out of range value, so it cannot be below
nit: in this case coercion is executed by caller. We might want to think about changing this in the future, so that coercion is executed by service threads

nodes.bodyText: Let's extract this to io.prestosql.sql.DynamicFilters. I think it's being used in more than one place
move private method to the bottom (after usages).
static import floatToIntBits
Is not-same as original tested anywhere? Preferably we should have a test case where there is a range that can be coerced and an exact value that cannot be coerced.
is it tested (or possible to test)?
add a test case where both high and low are below and over target range
add a test case where low is outside of target type range.
static import applySaturatedCasts (similar in DynamicFilteringService)
put in single line
it should be the other way around, l.suppkey (probe) should be joined with s.suppkey_decimal (build)
TestMemorySmoke#testJoinDynamicFilteringImplicitCoercion should also start filtering.

nodes.bodyText: put these in same line
DF from single task is sufficient (test will be simpler). In this test we are testing coercions explicitly.
Let's drop it then.
An example here would be decimal range where lo/hi is below INTEGER_MIN for instance

Target domain is narrower. E.g.: BIGINT -> INTEGER coercion where the bigint is outside integer range.

That's not the case. when floor coerced value is lower than original value, it is from domain.

Are we guaranteed that the value returned by saturated floor cast will always return the largest possible value in the target type that is smaller than the original value ?

Yes.
I mean both low and hi should be either very negative (out of range) or very positive (out of range).
upper bound is missing, but should be there
add a not that this doesn't handle NaNs since it's being used by dynamic filtering and NaNs are not possible
put in previous line
make 234567L, true not inclusive. It should become inclusive
undo
It's still collected as BIGINT.

commit.message: Allow dynamic filters with implicit coercion cast in planner
Implement dynamic filter coercion in execution

afterCommit.message: Implement dynamic filter coercion in execution

nodes.bodyText:
There are two possible approaches: SATURATED_FLOOR_CAST and coerce-coerce (as in UnwrapCastInComparison).
What was the reason to choose the former over the latter?
Can we capture the reasoning in writing somewhere?
cc @sopel39 @martint
